title: Westlife's emotional music video gives first real glimpse of Mark Feehily's baby
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Westlife 's new music video gives fans their first real glimpse of Mark Feehily 's baby.

The singer welcomed his first child, a little girl named Layla, with fiancé Cailean O'Neill 24 days ago today.

Up until now, fans have only seen one image of the baby lying in a plastric crib as Mark and Cailean wheel her home from the hospital - and her face was not visible.

But fans can see the adorable youngster properly for the first time in Mirror Online's exclusive preview of music video My Blood.

The emotional black and white music video features all 10 Westlife babies.

Shane Filan stars alongside his children Nicole, 14, Patrick, 11, and Shane Jr, nine, while Kian Egan is seen with his kids Koa, seven, Zekey, four and Cobi, two.

Nicky Byrne's kids also make an appearane. He's seen with twins Rocco and Jay, 12, and Gia, six.

The beautiful video sees the Irish boyband lark about and play with their kids, and pick them up for hugs and kisses as they sing about how their parents protected them and they want to do the same.

The video also features throwback pictures of the lads with loved ones throughout their lives.

The kids also take centre stage to sing along to the powerful track from their forthcoming album Spectrum.

My Blood was co-written by Ed Sheeran and Steve Mac.

Taking a break from X Factor live show rehearsals, Westlife’s co-manager Louis Walsh, told Mirror Online: "This is the best single from the new album. It is a brilliant, classic Westlife mid-tempo ballad.

"It means so much to the guys to have their families involved. The fans will love this video. Westlife are back. They’re national music treasures. People have fallen in love with them all over again."

The boys added: "My Blood has such beautiful lyrics. It is a powerful, heartfelt song which has such a strong meaning for all of us. The single reflects where we are at this time in our lives - raising children and starting families.

"This is our fourth single that has been co-written by Ed Sheeran and Steve Mac. It has been brilliant to work with them. My Blood is the prefect lead into our upcoming album Spectrum."

Mark has previously opened up to Mirror Online about becoming a dad for the first time.

The singer excitedly made the announcement while on stage with his band at Dublin's Croke Park as part of their Twenty Tour.

And chatting exclusively to us backstage, Mark, 39, talked about starting a family.

He said: "It just feels like the right time to start a family now. It is something that I’ve always wanted to do but it has always been about timing.

"Cailean and I are really happy and now that I’m in my late 30s and settled at home in Sligo, it is the right moment.

"The Westlife lads have all got nine kids between them, ours will be the tenth Westlife baby. What’s been great about this recent tour is that all of the families have been involved, kids and all, running around backstage.

"It is different from the older days but it is just brilliant. Having everyone around us brings a fantastic energy. We’ve had to set up a special family room for everyone at every stadium and arena we’ve played at, it's been great. The Westlife kids have loved it I think."

* Spectrum is out on November 15 - pre-order it here

* Westlife are playing London's Wembley Stadium next year - click here for tickets

description: EXCLUSIVE: The Irish boyband's 10 children - including Mark's new baby - feature in the video for new single My Blood
